variants.Description in input context: G2019S is the most common known genetic cause of PD, associated with familial and non-familial cases. It has higher kinase activity, altered ATP K m,app, and 1.6-fold greater sensitivity to ATP-competitive inhibitors at 1 mM ATP.

I2020T is a PD-associated mutant with lower kinase activity in substrate phosphorylation assays but higher activity in autophosphorylation assays. It exhibits 10-fold greater resistance to ATP-competitive inhibitors at 1 mM ATP and 6-fold higher ATP affinity compared to wild-type.
